data.title: Page 370 – eFlora of India
data.text:
Xanthophyllum flavescens Roxb. (India (Assam, Meghalaya, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Kerala), Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Sumatra, Borneo, Philippines (Luzon, Mindoro, Masbate, Guimaras, Negros, Mindanao), Palawan, Thailand, Myanmar [Burma] (Mon, Sagaing, Yangon, Kayin, Bago), peninsular Malaysia (Kelantan, Perak), Laos, Vietnam as per Catalogue of Life) Species as per Flora of Peninsular India: Xanthophyllum arnottianum syn. (India (Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Skkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tirpura, Meghalaya, Madhya Pradesh), Nepal, Bangladesh, Vietnam, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Myanmar [Burma] (Mandalay, Yangon), Thailand, Sumatra (incl. (Syn: Lapsana koelpinia L.f.; Rhagadiolus koelpinia Willd.); Images by Gurcharan Singh (Inserted by J.M.Garg) (For more images & complete details, click on the links) Koelpinia linearis Pall. from Srinagar, Kashmir: Koelpinia linearis Pall., Reise Russ. (Images by Gurcharan Singh (Inserted by J.M.Garg) (For more images & complete details, click on the links)) ‎Koelpinia page (‎‎‎‎‎‎‎Asteraceae (Compositae)‎) with images of species in efloraofindia : 1 post by 1 author. Pl. go through ‎Koelpinia page (Asteraceae (Compositae)‎) with images of species in efloraofindia (done by me). If you find any mis-identification, […]

Asystasia crispata Benth., Linnaea 24: 647 1851. (Syn: Asystasia coromandeliana Wight; Ruellia chelonoides Wall.); India (SW-Ghats) as per Catalogue of Life; Images by Prabhu Kumar K M, Identified by Vijayasankar Raman (Inserted by J.M.Garg) Identification: This plant I am collected from Nilgiri, Tamil Nadu.I collect this from wild.I feel this Asystasia is a […]

Elaeodendron species As per efi thread; Cassine species: I would very much appreciate seeing a picture of a ripe fruit of a species of Cassine. The colour and shape is very diagnostic of the species. Also check if you find any fruit image at efi site links: /species/a—l/c/celastraceae/cassine Found these images of […]

Congo (Zaire), Uganda, Kenya, Rwanda, Burundi, Angola (incl. Cabinda), Zambia, South Sudan, Philippines (I), Puerto Rico (I), Trinidad & Tobago (I) as per Catalogue of Life) Flora of Peninsular India: Maesopsis […]

Millettia rubiginosa Wight & Arn.; India (N) ; Kerala ; Tamil Nadu as per ILDIS; Fabaceae Liane for identification 240712MK01: Please help me to identify this liane found in the rain forests of western ghats. Leaflet size: 15×5 cm; pod size: 6-8cm long Place: Vaalparai, TN Date: 12 July 2012 Habitat: Rain […]

Caralluma adscendens var. attenuata (Wight) Gravely & Mayur., Ind. Sp. Gen. Car. 13 1931. (Syn: Caralluma attenuata Wight); Images by tspkumar & K M Prabhu Kumar (inserted by TSP Kumar & J.M.Garg) Caralluma adscendens var. attenuata: This is Caralluma adscendens var. attenuata. I collected this species from Tamil Nadu. The type species of […]

Caralluma species; Caralluma sp: this plant has peculiar habits! notice how the stems start pushing into the soil and then out through the waterhole! i found this very interesting.. id help appreciated Excellent some species of Euphorbiaceae, I think peculiar feature is due t its xeric habit where the stem push into […]

Suaeda corniculata var. olufsenii (Paulsen) G.L. Chu, Fl. Reipubl. Popularis Sin. 25(2): 128-129 128 1979. (Syn: Suaeda olufsenii Paulsen); Images by Prashant Awale (Identified by Miroslav Dvorsky) (Inserted by J.M.Garg) ID request-021111-PKA1: Seen this prostrate herb in the sandy soil near Pangong Lake in Ladakh.Date/Time: 14-09-2011 / 04:30PMLocation: Pangong Lake, ladakh (Altitude: […]

Ligusticum elatum (Edgew.) C.B. Clarke, Fl. Brit. India 2(6): 698-699 698 1879. (Syn: Cortia elata Edgew. (Unresolved); Levisticum argutum Lindl.); Images by Suresh Rana (Id by Gurcharan Singh) (Inserted by J.M.Garg) (For more photos & complete details, click on the links) Plant for ID from Paddar valley J&K. 181211 SRANA 01: Kindly identify […]

1. For any mistake in identification or for becoming efloraofindia e-group member (for contributing towards building of efloraofindia or otherwise), pl. mail to indiantreepix@googlegroups.com or itpmods@googlegroups.com

2. For better viewing of species’ pages, colour scheme & formatting is being followed as: Description of the species, Details of other flora species on the same page, Uses/ harms, Distribution, Abundance/ Location/ Flowering time & date, Habit & habitat, Etymology & pronunciation, Other interesting information, stories etc., Others, Botanical names, Common names, Main point of discussion below, Discussion about Botanical names.
